name: Familial Hypophosphatemic Rickets with Hypercalciuria
chief_complaint: My child has been having bone pain and isn't growing like other kids their age
prognosis: Good with early diagnosis and treatment, but requires lifelong management to prevent complications
description: A rare X-linked dominant disorder of phosphate metabolism characterized by renal phosphate wasting, defective bone mineralization, and paradoxical elevation of 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D. Caused by mutations in the PHEX gene leading to increased FGF23 activity.
